dishes.dishdesc: Idli is a traditional South Indian steamed rice cake made from fermented rice and black lentil batter, often served with chutney or sambar.
Dosa is a thin, crispy South Indian pancake made from fermented rice and black lentil batter, cooked on a hot griddle until golden brown, commonly served with chutney and sambar.
Vegetable noodles are stir-fried noodles with mixed veggies, commonly seasoned with soy sauce and spices.

Paneer Butter Masala is a classic North Indian dish made with paneer (Indian cottage cheese) cooked in a rich and creamy tomato-based gravy, flavored with butter, cream, and a blend of aromatic spices.

Gobi Manchurian is a popular Indo-Chinese dish made with crispy fried cauliflower florets tossed in a tangy and spicy sauce, typically flavored with garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and other seasonings, often garnished with spring onions.
Pongal is a traditional South Indian dish made primarily with rice and lentils, typically seasoned with cumin, black pepper, and ginger, and often cooked with ghee (clarified butter) and cashews

Butter naan is a popular Indian flatbread made with refined flour, yeast, yogurt, and butter, typically cooked in a tandoor (clay oven) until soft, fluffy, and slightly charred, often brushed with butter before serving.
Naan is a leavened Indian flatbread, typically cooked in a tandoor oven and served with curries or other dishes.
